name: Amazon Rainforest
hint: World's largest tropical rainforest, spanning nine South American countries

name: Atacama Desert
hint: Driest non-polar desert in the world, in northern Chile

name: Patagonia
hint: Sparsely populated region at the southern end of the continent, shared by Argentina and Chile

name: Pampas
hint: Fertile lowland grasslands of Argentina, home to gauchos and cattle ranching

name: Pantanal
hint: World's largest tropical wetland, mostly in western Brazil

name: Andes Range
hint: Longest continental mountain range in the world, stretching the length of South America

name: Galapagos Islands
hint: Volcanic archipelago in the Pacific, where Darwin developed his theory of evolution

name: Angel Falls
hint: World's highest uninterrupted waterfall, in Venezuela's Canaima National Park

name: Tierra del Fuego
hint: Archipelago at the southernmost tip of South America, Land of Fire

name: Altiplano
hint: High plateau in the Andes, second-highest after the Tibetan Plateau

name: Strait of Magellan
hint: Historic waterway separating mainland South America from Tierra del Fuego

name: Iguazu Falls
hint: Spectacular system of 275 waterfalls on the Brazil-Argentina border wider than Niagara

name: Cape Horn
hint: Southernmost headland of South America, notorious for treacherous seas and storms

name: Drake Passage
hint: Body of water between South America and Antarctica, roughest sea crossing in the world

name: Perito Moreno Glacier
hint: Famous advancing glacier in Argentina's Los Glaciares National Park that calves spectacularly

name: Guiana Highlands
hint: Ancient geological formation in northern South America with dramatic tabletop mountains called tepuis

name: Colca Canyon
hint: One of the deepest canyons in the world in Peru, famous for Andean condor sightings

name: Orinoco Delta
hint: Vast river delta in eastern Venezuela where the Orinoco empties into the Atlantic

name: Gulf of Guayaquil
hint: Large inlet of the Pacific on Ecuador's coast, the largest gulf in South America

name: Beagle Channel
hint: Strait in Tierra del Fuego separating Chile and Argentina, named after Darwin's ship
